segments.text: From my vantage point, the scene feels like a still life painting but with a twist of madness.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The woman is so detached from the reality of the running water, almost as if she’s in a dream.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I’m surprised she hasn’t slipped yet; the floor must be a slick mess under her feet.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is practically defying gravity, perched precariously on that stool, risking it all for cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I feel a surge of anger at the environment she has created—so unaware, so relaxed amidst the storm.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: And yet, it’s hard not to feel a twinge of happiness as the girl leans in, hopeful for some cookies.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s such a strange juxtaposition—the chaos of the inside and the calm of the garden outside.
segments.speaker: PAR
